p: Hotchkiss et al. [ 104] investigated the general mechanism by which an antimycotic-incorporated LDPE film can inhibit surface mold growth in packaged foods. The LDPE film containing concentration of 2000 mg/kg imazalil can delay the growth of A. toxicarius on potato dextrose agar, whereas the LDPE film containing 1000 mg/kg imazalil markedly delays the growth of Penicillium sp. and mold on cheddar cheese. Thus, the incorporation of an antimycotic agent, such as imazalil, into food contact packaging films can inhibit surface mold growth.
